events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred on a rainy afternoon involving another vehicle in downtown traffic.
Claim was reviewed and categorized appropriately as an auto accident claim due to vehicle collision.
An insurance agent specializing in auto accident claims was assigned to handle and follow up on this case.
The claim was acknowledged by the insurance company and confirmation was sent to the claimant promptly.
Additional documents including police report, accident photos, and vehicle damage estimates were requested from the insured.
The insured submitted all requested documents timely, including police reports and repair shop estimates.
The investigation began to assess the details of the accident and verify claim eligibility.
The investigation concluded confirming the insured’s liability and extent of vehicle damages.
A settlement proposal was prepared and communicated to the claimant for approval regarding vehicle repair costs.
The claimant provided feedback expressing satisfaction with the timely processing and clear communication.
The settlement terms were approved by both parties following agreement on the coverage and reparations.
The payment covering the approved repair costs was successfully issued to the claimant’s account.
The claim file was officially closed after confirmation of payment receipt and completed repairs.
